at line 19
static array getAllCurrencies(bool $alsoUnused = false, bool $alsoNotTender = false, string $locale = '')

Returns all the currencies.

Parameters

bool $alsoUnused Set to true to receive also currencies not currently used by any country, false otherwise
bool $alsoNotTender Set to true to receive also currencies that aren't legal tender in any country
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set with {@link \Punic\Data::setDefaultLocale()}.

Return Value

array Array keys are the currency code, array values are the currency name. It's sorted by currency values

at line 64
static string getName(string $currencyCode, null|number|string $quantity = null, string $locale = '')

Returns the name of a currency given its code.

Parameters

string $currencyCode The currency code
null|number|string $quantity The quantity identifier. Allowed values:

  • `null` to return the standard name, not associated to any quantity
  • `number` to return the name following the plural rule for the specified quantity
  • string `'zero'|'one'|'two'|'few'|'many'|'other'` the plural rule
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set with {@link \Punic\Data::setDefaultLocale()}.

Return Value

string Returns an empty string if $currencyCode is not valid, the localized currency name otherwise

at line 95
static string getSymbol(string $currencyCode, string $which = '', string $locale = '')

Returns the name of a currency given its code.

Parameters

string $currencyCode The currency code
string $which Which symbol flavor do you prefer? 'narrow' for narrow symbols, 'alt' for alternative. Other values: standard/default symbol
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set with {@link \Punic\Data::setDefaultLocale()}.

Return Value

string Returns an empty string if $currencyCode is not valid, the localized currency name otherwise

at line 137
static string getNumericCode(string $currencyCode)

Returns the ISO 4217 code for a currency given its currency code.

Historical currencies are not supported.

Parameters

string $currencyCode The 3-letter currency code

Return Value

string Returns the numeric ISO 427 code, or an empty string if $currencyCode is not valid

See also

http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-info.html#Supplemental_Code_Mapping

at line 160
static string getByNumericCode(string $code)

Returns the currency code given its ISO 4217 code.

Historical currencies are not supported.

Parameters

string $code The numeric ISO 427 code

Return Value

string Returns the 3-letter currency code, or an empty string if $code is not valid

See also

http://unicode.org/reports/tr35/tr35-info.html#Supplemental_Code_Mapping

at line 187
static array getCurrencyHistoryForTerritory(string $territoryCode)

Return the history for the currencies used in a territory.

Parameters

string $territoryCode The territoy code

Return Value

array Return a list of items with these keys:

  • string `currency`: the currency code (always present)
  • string `from`: start date of the currency validity in the territory (not present if no start date) - Format is YYYY-MM-DD
  • string `to`: end date of the currency validity in the territory (not present if no end date) - Format is YYYY-MM-DD
  • bool `tender`: true if the currency was or is legal tender, false otherwise (always present)

at line 215
static string getCurrencyForTerritory(string $territoryCode)

Return the currency to be used in a territory.

Parameters

string $territoryCode The territoy code

Return Value

string Returns an empty string if $territoryCode is not valid or we don't have info about it, the currency code otherwise
